function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The web application displays the cart overlay for the Samsung Store, showing one product (Galaxy A2 Core) in the cart with options to remove the item or change its quantity. The cart footer shows the total cost and offers buttons for clearing the cart and proceeding to checkout. The 'Your cart' header, product details, quantity controls, 'clear cart', and 'checkout' functionalities are prominent on this overlay.","new_testing_goal":"Evaluate the cart's update mechanism by adding another product from a different category and testing the quantity adjustment feature.","explanation":"First, return to the product listing by closing the cart overlay. Then, navigate to another product category and add a different product to the cart to observe if the cart correctly updates with multiple items. Afterwards, open the cart and use the quantity adjustment features to see how well the cart updates quantities and totals.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r9:"}}

messages.content: Given a web application, you are tasked with assisting in testing its functionality. The emulate_interaction function takes an interaction as input and emulates it on the web application. The return value of the function is the new, filtered HTML source code of the web application. The source code of previous interactions will be omitted from the input to the assistant.
Here are some examples how the 'emulate_interaction' function should be used.
Please test my website: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description": "The start page of a web site with multiple calculators for different purposes. There are buttons to navigate to the differet calculators and a button to switch the language of the web site. The current language is English.", "new_testing_goal": "Test the calculator for calculating the area of a circle in multiple languages.", "explanation": "First navigate to the calculator for the area of a circle. Then input a radius and calculate the area. Switch the language of the web site and repeat the process.", "interaction": {"interaction_type": "click", "element_id": "btn-area-circle"}}

messages.content: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases. Here is the filtered HTML source code of the web application: 'omitted'.

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The web application is a Samsung Store that features a navigation bar with links to different product categories such as Home, Galaxy, S10, M Series, and A Series. The main banner promotes shopping now for Galaxy products. Below the banner, there are sections for products like Galaxy S10 5G, Galaxy S10+, Galaxy S10, and Galaxy S10e, each with an 'add to cart' button. Additionally, there's a cart icon in the top navigation indicating the number of items in the cart, which currently shows 0 items.","new_testing_goal":"Explore the product categories and product details to examine their loading and display functionalities. Test adding products to the cart and then check the cart's functionality.","explanation":"First, navigate through the different product categories by clicking on their corresponding links in the navigation bar to check if the products associated with each category are correctly displayed. Next, add a product to the cart to see if the cart updates correctly. Finally, click on the cart icon to view the cart and assess its functionality.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r1:"}}

messages.name: emulate_interaction
messages.content: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"A Samsung Store web application showcasing various products under categories such as Galaxy, S10, M Series, and A Series, along with a main banner for Galaxy products. The products displayed include Galaxy S10 5G, Galaxy S10+, Galaxy S10, and Galaxy S10e, each with an 'add to cart' button. The navigation bar includes a cart icon indicating no items in the cart currently.","explanation":"Navigate to the Galaxy category to check if the products associated with this category are correctly displayed. This will help in evaluating the loading functionality of product categories.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r0:-galaxy"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The Galaxy product category page within the Samsung Store features a list of Galaxy series products, including S10 5G, S10+, S10, S10e, A2 Core, M30, M20, M10, A80, A70, A60, and A30. Each product is displayed with an image, name, price, and an 'add to cart' button. The navigation bar has links to Home, Galaxy, S10, M Series, and A Series.","new_testing_goal":"Test the addition of multiple products from different categories to the cart and the removal of these items to evaluate cart functionality and update mechanisms.","explanation":"Add a product from the Galaxy category to the cart to check if it updates correctly. Then, navigate to another product category and repeat the process. Finally, view the cart and attempt to remove an item to test the cart's removal functionality.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":"5:rc:"}}

The user provided the following end instructions: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases.

Pursue your self-assigned sub-goal or assign a new one: Test the addition of multiple products from different categories to the cart and the removal of these items to evaluate cart functionality and update mechanisms..

Previously executed interactions by goal: {"Explore the product categories and product details to examine their loading and display functionalities. Test adding products to the cart and then check the cart's functionality.": 2, "Test the addition of multiple products from different categories to the cart and the removal of these items to evaluate cart functionality and update mechanisms.": 1}.

Start by describing the website supplied by the function call. Give a short general description first then summarize the main elements on the website. Do not use HTML in your description. Then you may formulate a high level sub-goal to the user's instructions, that should be persued with the next couple of interactions. You should formulate a new sub-goal if the current one has been completed or seems to be unattainable. Give an action plan that explains how the goal should be reached. And finally, describe the interaction to emulate.
Only use the click action with clickable elements. The clickable elements have the following ids: :r6:, :r8:, :ra:, :rb:, :r9:, :re:, :rf:, :rg:, :r7:.

functions.name: emulate_interaction
functions.description: Emulates a user interaction with the web application

page_description.description: A short textual description of the state of the web application: What is the current page? What are the main elements on the page? This description should not contain any HTML.

new_testing_goal.description: Assigns a new high level sub-goal that shall be followed in order to complete the users instructions. This goal should take multiple user interactions to complete. The assistant shall try to complete this goal in the next couple of interactions and then assign a new one.

explanation.description: An action plan that explains how the goal should be reached.

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with
